intro: Gilia attenuata f. helleri, commonly known as Heller's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive, slender shape. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable habitats.
